title: Ticket #1434: Quill Error_Sqllogs table lossage causes disk fill up
description:
In file src/condor_tt/ttmanager.cpp, in function void TTManager::handleErrorSqlLog() something stupid happens.

Suppose we have a situation where an insertion in the horizontal table fails due to a type mistake on the value (e.g., coresize = "eleventy-billion" instead of coresize = 11000000).

At this point, the erroneous query AND the entire schedd_sql.log file is inserted into new a row in the Error_Sqllogs table.

So, if you have a 1 Meg schedd_sql.log file, and have 1000 errors in it, you will consume 1GB of storage in the DB by having 1000 new rows inserted in the Error_Sqllogs table with each row having one copy of the schedd_sql.log file.

condor_dbmsd will eventually get around to dropping and resetting that table. However, if it isn't running, or there are more errors with a large enough schedd_sql.log file that in one bulk load you fill the disk, you get screwed.

The fix we're thinking of at this time is to simply stop appending the log file into the table and fill that entry with a "N/A" string or some such thing when it happens. We need to rethink why that code was storing the entire log like this.
